A New Signal for a Neutron Star Collisio.title: A New Signal for a Neutron Star Collision Discovered
A New Signal for a Neutron Star Collisio.desc: A bright burst of X-rays has been discovered by NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory in a galaxy 6.6 billion light years from Earth. This event likely signaled the merger of two neutron stars and could give astronomers fresh insight into how neutron stars – dense stellar objects packed mainly with neutrons – are built.

Storm Rages in Cosmic Teacup.title: Storm Rages in Cosmic Teacup
Storm Rages in Cosmic Teacup.desc: In a galaxy hosting a structure nicknamed the "Teacup," a galactic storm is raging.

Galactic Bubbles Play Cosmic Pinball wit.title: Galactic Bubbles Play Cosmic Pinball with Energetic Particles
Galactic Bubbles Play Cosmic Pinball wit.desc: We all know bubbles from soapy baths or sodas. These bubbles of everyday experience on Earth are only a few inches across, and consist of a thin film of liquid enclosing a small volume of air or other gas. In space, however, there are very different bubbles – composed of a lighter gas inside a heavier one – and they can be huge.

Astronomers Find Dark Energy May Vary Ov.title: Astronomers Find Dark Energy May Vary Over Time
Astronomers Find Dark Energy May Vary Ov.desc: A new study using data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory and ESA's XMM-Newton suggests that dark energy may have varied over cosmic time.

Cosmic Fountain Powered by Giant Black H.title: Cosmic Fountain Powered by Giant Black Hole
Cosmic Fountain Powered by Giant Black H.desc: The Abell 2597 galaxy cluster shows the first clear evidence for the simultaneous inward and outward flow of gas being driven by a supermassive black hole.

Double Trouble: A White Dwarf Surprises.title: Double Trouble: A White Dwarf Surprises Astronomers
Double Trouble: A White Dwarf Surprises.desc: Astronomers have detected a bright X-ray outburst from a star in the Small Magellanic Cloud, a nearby galaxy almost 200,000 light years from Earth. A combination of X-ray and optical data indicate that the source of this radiation is a white dwarf star that may be the fastest-growing white dwarf ever observed.

Abell 1033: To Boldly Go into Colliding.title: Abell 1033: To Boldly Go into Colliding Galaxy Clusters
Abell 1033: To Boldly Go into Colliding.desc: Hidden in a distant galaxy cluster collision are wisps of gas resembling the starship Enterprise — an iconic spaceship from the "Star Trek" franchise.

Kes 75: Milky Way's Youngest Pulsar Expo.title: Kes 75: Milky Way's Youngest Pulsar Exposes Secrets of Star's Demise
Kes 75: Milky Way's Youngest Pulsar Expo.desc: Scientists have confirmed the identity of the youngest known pulsar in the Milky Way galaxy using data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory. This result could provide astronomers new information about how some stars end their lives.

Making Head or Tail of a Galactic Landsc.title: Making Head or Tail of a Galactic Landscape
Making Head or Tail of a Galactic Landsc.desc: Astronomers have used data from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory to capture a dramatic image of an enormous tail of hot gas stretching for more than a million light years behind a group of galaxies that is falling into the depths of an even-larger cluster of galaxies.

Cosmic Collision Forges Galactic One Rin.title: Cosmic Collision Forges Galactic One Ring—in X-rays
Cosmic Collision Forges Galactic One Rin.desc: Astronomers have used NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory to discover a ring of black holes or neutron stars in a galaxy 300 million light years from Earth.

Chandra Detects a Coronal Mass Ejection.title: Chandra Detects a Coronal Mass Ejection From Another Star
Chandra Detects a Coronal Mass Ejection.desc: The Chandra X-Ray Observatory detects a coronal mass ejection from a star other than the Sun for the first time.

Heart of Lonesome Galaxy Is Brimming wit.title: Heart of Lonesome Galaxy Is Brimming with Dark Matter
Heart of Lonesome Galaxy Is Brimming wit.desc: Isolated for billions of years, a galaxy with more dark matter packed into its core than expected has been identified by astronomers using data from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory.

X-rays Spot Spinning Black Holes Across.title: X-rays Spot Spinning Black Holes Across Cosmic Sea
X-rays Spot Spinning Black Holes Across.desc: Using data from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory and chance alignments across billions of light years, astronomers have deployed a new technique to measure the spin of five supermassive black holes.

Chandra Spots a Mega-Cluster of Galaxies.title: Chandra Spots a Mega-Cluster of Galaxies in the Making
Chandra Spots a Mega-Cluster of Galaxies.desc: When two pairs of galaxy clusters collide, the result is not four separate objects, but one giant galaxy cluster.

The Clumpy and Lumpy Death of a Star.title: The Clumpy and Lumpy Death of a Star
The Clumpy and Lumpy Death of a Star.desc: A new image of the Tycho supernova remnant from Chandra reveals an intriguing pattern of bright clumps and fainter holes giving clues about its origin.

Found: Three Black Holes On Collision Co.title: Found: Three Black Holes On Collision Course
Found: Three Black Holes On Collision Co.desc: A study using data from Chandra and other telescopes provides the strongest evidence yet for three supermassive black holes on a collision course.

Scientists Discover Black Hole Has Three.title: Scientists Discover Black Hole Has Three Hot Meals a Day
Scientists Discover Black Hole Has Three.desc: A supermassive black hole is blasting out X-rays about every nine hours, according to data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory and ESA's XMM-Newton.

The Latest Look at \"First Light\" from.title: The Latest Look at "First Light" from Chandra
The Latest Look at \"First Light\" from.desc: NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory has captured many spectacular images of cosmic phenomena over its two decades of operations, but perhaps its most iconic is the supernova remnant called Cassiopeia A.

Black Hole Nurtures Baby Stars a Million.title: Black Hole Nurtures Baby Stars a Million Light-Years Away
Black Hole Nurtures Baby Stars a Million.desc: Black holes are famous for ripping objects apart, including stars. But now, astronomers have uncovered a black hole that may have sparked the births of stars over a mind-boggling distance, and across multiple galaxies.

Stars Are Being Born in the Depths of a.title: Stars Are Being Born in the Depths of a Black Hole
Stars Are Being Born in the Depths of a.desc: In the Phoenix constellation, astronomers have confirmed the first example of a galaxy cluster where large numbers of stars are being born at its core.

A Weakened Black Hole Allows Its Galaxy.title: A Weakened Black Hole Allows Its Galaxy to Awaken
A Weakened Black Hole Allows Its Galaxy.desc: Astronomers have confirmed the first example of a galaxy cluster where large numbers of stars are being born at its core.

Black Hole Nurtures Baby Stars a Million.title: Black Hole Nurtures Baby Stars a Million Light Years Away
Black Hole Nurtures Baby Stars a Million.desc: Astronomers have uncovered a black hole that may have sparked the birth of stars over a phenomenal distance of more than a million light years and across multiple galaxies.

Combing Through the \"X-ray Files\".title: Combing Through the "X-ray Files"
Combing Through the \"X-ray Files\".desc: Six objects in the Large Magellanic Cloud about 160,000 light years away.

Cloaked Black Hole Discovered in Early U.title: Cloaked Black Hole Discovered in Early Universe using NASA's Chandra
Cloaked Black Hole Discovered in Early U.desc: Found at a time only about 850 million years after the Big Bang, this black hole could help us better understand an important epoch in the history of the Universe.

NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory Celebra.title: NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory Celebrates Its 20th Anniversary
NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory Celebra.desc: To commemorate the 20th anniversary of Chandra X-ray Observatory, an assembly of new images is being released.

Galaxy Gathering Brings Warmth.title: Galaxy Gathering Brings Warmth
Galaxy Gathering Brings Warmth.desc: Two colliding groups of galaxies located about 380 million light years from Earth.

Famous Black Hole Has Jet Pushing Cosmic.title: Famous Black Hole Has Jet Pushing Cosmic Speed Limit
Famous Black Hole Has Jet Pushing Cosmic.desc: These images show evidence from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory that the black hole in the galaxy M87 is blasting particles out at over 99% the speed of light.

Galactic Pyrotechnics From 23 Million Li.title: Galactic Pyrotechnics From 23 Million Light Years Away
Galactic Pyrotechnics From 23 Million Li.desc: NGC 4258, a galaxy about 23 million light years away, is the site of impressive, ongoing fireworks.

NASA's Great Observatories Help Astronom.title: NASA's Great Observatories Help Astronomers Build a 3D Visualization of Exploded Star
NASA's Great Observatories Help Astronom.desc: Astronomers and visualization specialists from NASA's Universe of Learning program have combined X-ray, visible, and infrared wavelengths to create a 3D representation of the dynamic Crab Nebula.

Abell 2384: Bending the Bridge Between T.title: Abell 2384: Bending the Bridge Between Two Galaxy Clusters
Abell 2384: Bending the Bridge Between T.desc: Several hundred million years ago, two galaxy clusters collided and then passed through each other.

Bending the Bridge Between Two Galaxy Cl.title: Bending the Bridge Between Two Galaxy Clusters
Bending the Bridge Between Two Galaxy Cl.desc: Several hundred million years ago, two galaxy clusters collided and then passed through each other. This mighty event released a flood of hot gas from each galaxy cluster that formed an unusual bridge between the two objects.

Viewing Our Galactic Center.title: Viewing Our Galactic Center
Viewing Our Galactic Center.desc: The central region of our galaxy, the Milky Way, contains an exotic collection of objects.

Chandra Data Tests 'Theory of Everything.title: Chandra Data Tests 'Theory of Everything'
Chandra Data Tests 'Theory of Everything.desc: Astronomers used Chandra to perform a test of string theory, a possible "theory of everything" that would tie all of known physics together.

Star Survives Close Call with a Black Ho.title: Star Survives Close Call with a Black Hole
Star Survives Close Call with a Black Ho.desc: Astronomers may have discovered a new kind of survival story: a star that had a brush with a giant black hole and lived to tell the tale through exclamations of X-rays.

Universe's Expansion May Not Be The Same.title: Universe's Expansion May Not Be The Same In All Directions
Universe's Expansion May Not Be The Same.desc: This graphic contains a map of the full sky and shows four of the hundreds of galaxy clusters that were analyzed to test whether the Universe is the same in all directions over large scales.

Chandra Data Tests \"Theory of Everythin.title: Chandra Data Tests "Theory of Everything"
Chandra Data Tests \"Theory of Everythin.desc: Astronomers using NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory have made one of the first experimental tests of string theory, a set of models intended to tie together all known forces, particles, and interactions.

Record-Breaking Explosion by Black Hole.title: Record-Breaking Explosion by Black Hole Spotted
Record-Breaking Explosion by Black Hole.desc: Astronomers have discovered the biggest explosion seen in the Universe in a galaxy cluster 390 million light years away.

A Cosmic Jekyll and Hyde.title: A Cosmic Jekyll and Hyde
A Cosmic Jekyll and Hyde.desc: Astronomers have spotted a double star system is flip-flopping between two alter egos using NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory and other telescopes.

Stellar Explosions and Jets Showcased in.title: Stellar Explosions and Jets Showcased in New Three Dimensional Visualizations
Stellar Explosions and Jets Showcased in.desc: These six visualizations represent work to explore rich datasets from powerful telescopes, like Chandra, by developing three-dimensional simulations.

Setting the Clock on a Stellar Explosion.title: Setting the Clock on a Stellar Explosion
Setting the Clock on a Stellar Explosion.desc: It is often difficult to determine the timeline of a star's demise. By studying the spectacular remains of a supernova, a team has found enough clues to help wind back the clock.

NASA Telescopes Capture Stellar Delivery.title: NASA Telescopes Capture Stellar Delivery Service for Black Hole
NASA Telescopes Capture Stellar Delivery.desc: Astronomers may have witnessed a smaller galaxy colliding with a larger spiral galaxy and delivering a supermassive black hole.

Zeta Ophiuchi: A Star With a Complicated.title: Zeta Ophiuchi: A Star With a Complicated Past
Zeta Ophiuchi: A Star With a Complicated.desc: Zeta Ophiuchi is a star with a complicated past, having likely been ejected from its birthplace by a powerful stellar explosion. A new look by NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory helps tell more of the story of this runaway star.

Embracing a Rejected Star.title: Embracing a Rejected Star
Embracing a Rejected Star.desc: Zeta Ophiuchi is a star with a complicated past, having likely been ejected from its birthplace by a powerful stellar explosion. A new look by NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory helps tell more of the story of this runaway star.

Chandra Shows Giant Black Hole Spins Slo.title: Chandra Shows Giant Black Hole Spins Slower Than Its Peers
Chandra Shows Giant Black Hole Spins Slo.desc: Astronomers used NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory to determine the spin of the black hole in H1821+643, making it the most massive one to have an accurate measurement of this fundamental property.

NASA\u2019s Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-.title: NASA’s Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-ray Speed Trap
NASA\u2019s Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-.desc: A young pulsar is blazing through the Milky Way at a speed of over a million miles per hour. This stellar speedster, witnessed by NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory, is one of the fastest objects of its kind ever seen. This result teaches astronomers more about how some of the bigger stars end their lives.

Sagittarius A*: NASA Telescopes Support.title: Sagittarius A*: NASA Telescopes Support Event Horizon Telescope in Studying Milky Way's Black Hole
Sagittarius A*: NASA Telescopes Support.desc: Multiple telescopes, including Chandra, observed the Milky Way's giant black hole simultaneously with the Event Horizon Telescope (EHT). This combined effort gave insight into what is happening farther out than the field-of-view of the EHT.

Black Holes Raze Thousands of Stars to F.title: Black Holes Raze Thousands of Stars to Fuel Growth
Black Holes Raze Thousands of Stars to F.desc: Astronomers have found evidence for the destruction of thousands of stars in multiple galaxies, using NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory. Growing black holes within dense stellar clusters are thought to be responsible for this large-scale devastation.

Feasting Black Holes Caught in Galactic.title: Feasting Black Holes Caught in Galactic Spiderweb
Feasting Black Holes Caught in Galactic.desc: Often, a spiderweb conjures the idea of captured prey soon to be consumed by a waiting predator. In the case of the "Spiderweb" protocluster, however, objects that lie within a giant cosmic web are feasting and growing, according to data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory.

Tiny Star Unleashes Gargantuan Beam of M.title: Tiny Star Unleashes Gargantuan Beam of Matter and Antimatter
Tiny Star Unleashes Gargantuan Beam of M.desc: A city-sized collapsed star has generated a beam of matter and antimatter that stretches for trillions of miles.

NASA's IXPE Helps Unlock the Secrets of.title: NASA's IXPE Helps Unlock the Secrets of Famous Exploded Star
NASA's IXPE Helps Unlock the Secrets of.desc: Astronomers have made the first measurement in X-rays of the polarization from the remains of an exploded star called Cassiopeia A.

NASA's Chandra Finds Galaxy Cluster Coll.title: NASA's Chandra Finds Galaxy Cluster Collision on a "WHIM"
NASA's Chandra Finds Galaxy Cluster Coll.desc: Astronomers taking inventory of the material in the local universe keep coming up short. A new result from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory about a system of colliding galaxy clusters may help explain this shortfall.

NASA's Chandra Adds X-ray Vision to Webb.title: NASA's Chandra Adds X-ray Vision to Webb Images
NASA's Chandra Adds X-ray Vision to Webb.desc: Images combining Webb infrared data with X-rays collected by Chandra underscore how the power of any of these telescopes is only enhanced when joined with others.

NASA's Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-ray S.title: NASA's Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-ray Speed Trap
NASA's Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-ray S.desc: A young pulsar is blazing through the Milky Way at a speed of over a million miles per hour. This stellar speedster is one of the fastest objects of its kind ever seen.

Colossal Collisions Linked to Solar Syst.title: Colossal Collisions Linked to Solar System Science
Colossal Collisions Linked to Solar Syst.desc: A new study shows a deep connection between some of the largest, most energetic events in the Universe and much smaller, weaker ones powered by our own Sun.

NASA Telescopes Support Event Horizon Te.title: NASA Telescopes Support Event Horizon Telescope in Studying Milky Way's Black Hole
NASA Telescopes Support Event Horizon Te.desc: As the Event Horizon Telescope was collecting data for its remarkable new image of the Milky Way's supermassive black hole, a legion of other telescopes, including Chandra, was also watching.
